summaryText: Pastor Travis Hearn delivered a powerful and deeply personal sermon about understanding the purpose of pain in our lives, diving deep into 2 Corinthians 12:7-10. Using the metaphor of a 'thorn in the flesh', PT shares five profound insights about how God uses pain: to keep us humble, to make us dependent on Him, to strengthen us, to refine us, and to prepare us for our purpose. Drawing from his own experience of a brain aneurysm and stroke, Pastor Travis vulnerably shares how even in our most broken moments, God is working to transform us. The key message? There's no pain in vain. Every challenge, every struggle has a divine purpose. Whether it's a physical ailment, emotional trauma, or personal setback, God is using these 'thorns' to shape us into His image. Pastor Travis challenges us to stop seeing our struggles as punishments and start viewing them as purposeful processes designed to reveal God's glory. The most powerful moment? When he declares that our deepest pain can become our most impactful ministry - a testimony of God's incredible grace and transformative power.
mainPoints: Pain makes me dependent on God
Pain prepares me for my purpose

versesMentioned.text: Therefore, in order to keep me from becoming conceited, I was given a thorn in my flesh, a messenger of Satan, to torment me. Three times I pleaded with the Lord to take it away from me. But he said to me, 'My grace is sufficient for you, for my power is made perfect in weakness.' Therefore I will boast all the more gladly about my weaknesses, so that Christ's power may rest on me. That is why, for Christ's sake, I delight in weaknesses, in insults, in hardships, in persecutions, in difficulties. For when I am weak, then I am strong.

Consider it pure joy, my brothers and sisters, whenever you face trials of many kinds, because you know that the testing of your faith produces perseverance. Let perseverance finish its work so that you may be mature and complete, not lacking anything.
'Father, if you are willing, take this cup from me; yet not my will, but yours be done.'
Before I was afflicted I went astray, but now I obey your word.
Who comforts us in all our troubles, so that we can comfort those in any trouble with the comfort we ourselves receive from God.
See, I have refined you, though not as silver; I have tested you in the furnace of affliction.
'Can I not do with you, Israel, as this potter does?' declares the Lord. 'Like clay in the hand of the potter, so are you in my hand, Israel.'

Monday.scripture: Psalm 34:18: 'The Lord is close to the brokenhearted and saves those who are crushed in spirit.'
Monday.action: Write down three current 'thorns' in your life. Reflect on how each might be an opportunity for growth, not just a source of pain.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me see my struggles through Your perspective. Give me wisdom to understand the purpose behind my pain and the strength to trust You in the process. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Romans 8:28: 'And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.'
Tuesday.action: Identify one past difficult experience that has shaped who you are today. Journal about how God might have used that experience to refine your character.
Tuesday.prayer: Father, thank You for never wasting my pain. Help me trust that You are working all things together for my good, even when I cannot see the full picture. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: James 1:2-4: 'Consider it pure joy, my brothers and sisters, whenever you face trials of many kinds, because you know that the testing of your faith produces perseverance.'
Wednesday.action: Reach out to someone who is currently going through a difficult season. Offer genuine encouragement and listen without judgment.
Wednesday.prayer: God, make me an instrument of Your comfort. Help me see trials as opportunities for growth and be a source of hope for others. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: 2 Corinthians 1:9: 'Indeed, we felt we had received the sentence of death. But this happened that we might not rely on ourselves but on God, who raises the dead.'
Thursday.action: Spend time in prayer, specifically identifying areas where you've been trying to handle things in your own strength. Surrender these to God.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, teach me true dependence on You. Help me release my need for control and trust in Your perfect plan. Strengthen my faith in Your sufficiency. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Isaiah 43:2: 'When you pass through the waters, I will be with you; and when you pass through the rivers, they will not sweep over you. When you walk through the fire, you will not be burned; the flames will not set you ablaze.'
Friday.action: Create a 'testimony list' of challenges God has helped you overcome. Reflect on God's faithfulness throughout your life's journey.
Friday.prayer: Heavenly Father, You are my constant in every storm. Thank You for Your unwavering presence. Help me remember Your past faithfulness when facing current challenges. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Philippians 3:10: 'I want to know Christ—yes, to know the power of his resurrection and participation in his sufferings, becoming like him in his death.'
Saturday.action: Spend time in quiet reflection. Ask God to reveal how He might be using your current challenges to make you more like Jesus.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, transform my pain into purpose. Help me see my struggles as opportunities to draw closer to You and reflect Your character. Make me more like Jesus through every trial. Amen.
